definition: seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
surrounded by distinguished friends (idiom); in company
guests filled all the seats (idiom); a house full of distinguished visitors

sentences.english: They say the best sauce is company.
sentences.chinese: 人們說高朋滿座是最佳的佐料。

sentences.english: The ensemble has played to sold-out houses in the Middle East and Europe.
sentences.chinese: 樂團演奏滿座房子是在中東和歐洲。

sentences.english: Four other Internet cafes in the area were also full.
sentences.chinese: 同一地區的其它四家網吧也是全部滿座。

sentences.english: The concert hall was packed to capacity with many people unable to get in.
sentences.chinese: 音樂廳已經滿座，還有很多人未能入場。

sentences.english: Deluged merchants have run out of products and appointment times.
sentences.chinese: 很多商家的產品已經售完，或者預定時間內滿座。

definition: to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
surrounded by distinguished friends (idiom); in company
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
to remain fresh in one's memory (idiom)
(of a city etc) ablaze with lights
